title: Compute the maximum water trapped by a pair of vertical lines
hint: Start with 0 and n-1 and work your way in.
problem:
An array of integers naturally defines a set of lines parallel to the Y-axis, starting from x = 0 as illustrated in the following figure. The goal of this problem is to find the pair of lines that together with the X-axis "trap" the most water.

Write a program which takes as input an integer array and returns the pair of entries that trap the maximum amount of water.

A graphical depiction of the array {1, 2, 1, 3, 4, 4, 5, 6, 2, 1, 3, 1, 3, 2, 1, 2, 4, 1}

The shaded area between 4 and 16 is the maximum water that can be trapped by the array
